Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of upper part of maenad facing right, supporting a tympanon with her left hand (hair in dilute glaze with four dotted laurel-type leaves, round earring, trace of necklace in dilute glaze, sleeveless chiton with outline ray decoration at neck); traces of object below; relief line throughout.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compare the squat lekythos, Berlin inv. 4906 (ARV2 1336, 4; Ghali-Kahil 1955, pl. 12, 1-3). Also published in CVA Bonn (1), p.22 pl.19.4.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.42 no. C 21 pl. 16.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1028)
